title: Is eating ground beef 3 times per week unhealthy? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, it’s not unhealthy. See Is [this food] healthy? Moderate your consumption of red meat. Eating large amounts can slightly raise your risk for colorectal cancer. And the cholesterol you eat is not the cholesterol in your blood. Don’t worry about cholesterol in food. Just ignore that. Stop thinking of any food in terms of how “unhealthy” it is. That, in and of itself, is unhealthy.

Anything in moderation won’t kill you. The question should be focused on portions rather than type of foods. The WHO issued a report that processed meats are carcinogenic (bacon). Ground beef is not processed red meat, and the WHO says that it has health benefits if you eat it in moderation. Separately, there is a study showing that ground beef is more likely than any other meat to contain feces and, therefore, must be cooked at high temperature and to well-done. Look up red meat benefits, there are plenty. Just don’t eat too much- portion control.
